title: Novak Djokovic's Visa Is Canceled by Australia for a Second Time; Immigration chief says decision is in the public interest
text:
The decision could end the No. 1 men's tennis player's chances of winning the Australian Open for a record 10th time. Top-seeded Djokovic had been slated to face fellow Serb Miomir KecmanoviÄ‡ in the opening round next week.

"In making this decision, I carefully considered information provided to me by the Department of Home Affairs, the Australian Border Force and Mr. Djokovic," Hawke said in a statement.

Hawke didn't immediately say whether Djokovic would be returned to the Melbourne hotel where he spent four days while he appealed an earlier cancellation of his visa, shortly after his arrival in Australia. That cancellation was based on rules that travelers to the country have to be vaccinated against Covid-19 and it was overturned by a judge on Monday because of a technicality.

No. 5 seed Andrey Rublev of Russia would likely take Djokovic's place in the draw under Grand Slam tournament withdrawal rules.

Tennis Australia, the governing body for the sport in the country, didn't immediately comment on the matter.

Write to Stuart Condie at stuart.condie@wsj.com

Novak Djokovic's Visa Is Canceled by Australia for a Second Time
